newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU to probe animal cloning.
newsitem.headline: EU to probe animal cloning.

text.p: European Commission President Jacques Santer ordered EU executive specialists on Thursday to investigate whether the European Union should take a stance on cloning of animals.
In a statement the Commission said Santer had ordered Commission services to investigate "if and to what extent" the EU should be involved in the issue.
Concern about the ethical issues posed by cloning are mounting following the successful cloning of a sheep by scientists in Scotland.
The researchers who cloned the sheep admit it could now become possible to clone a human being, although they denounced anyone who would try.
U.S. President Bill Clinton has ordered the U.S. National Bioethics Advisory Panel to report within 90 days on the legal and ethical ramifications of cloning, especially its implications for humans.
